name: They Left Us In 2001 Multiple Choice Quiz | Death Becomes Them | 15 Questions

questions.text: This director passed away on February 19, 2001. The list of movies he directed includes, 'Inherit The Wind', and 'Judgement at Nuremberg'. He was the producer of 'The Caine Mutiny'. What was his name?
questions.explanation:
Stanley Kramer.

	He also directed 1963's, 'It's a Mad Mad Mad Mad World'.

questions.text: This racehorse passed away on January 12, 2001 and was the last to win the coveted Triple Crown title. What was the horse's name?
questions.explanation:
'Affirmed'.

	In 1978 'Affirmed' and 'Alydar' finished 1-2 in all the Triple Crown races.

questions.text: Lorenzo Music was the voice of Carlton, the doorman, on the TV series 'Rhoda'. What animated character did he also lend his voice to?
questions.explanation:
Garfield.

	Lorenzo passed away at age 64 on August 4, 2001.

questions.text: Les Brown passed away on January 4, 2001 at age 88. What was his profession?
questions.explanation:
Big band musician.

	Les co-wrote 'Sentimental Journey', and was the leader of the Les Brown and the Band of Renown orchestra.

questions.text: Harold Stassen was famous for running for president of the U.S. nine times. What state was he governor of?
questions.explanation:
Minnesota.

	He passed away on March 4, 2001, at age 93.

questions.text: Ken Kesey passed away on November 10, 2001. He was credited with pioneering the Hippie movement and well known for writing this book. Can you name it?
questions.explanation:
'One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest'.

	'One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest' was made into a film in 1975, directed by Milos Foreman, and starred Jack Nicholson.

questions.text: Dr. Christiaan Barnard passed away on September 2, 2001 at age 78. He performed the first human heart transplant. In what city did he perform this operation?
questions.explanation:
Cape Town, South Africa.

	The operation took place on December 3, 1967.

questions.text: Nigel Hawthorne played Sir Humphrey Appleby in the British TV series, 'Yes, Minister', and 'Yes, Prime Minister', and starred as this English King in a 1994 film. Which king did he portray?
questions.explanation:
King George lll.

	Nigel passed away on December 26, 2001 (Boxing Day in the U.K.) at age 72.

questions.text: This cartoon creator passed away on March 22, 2001, and is best known for his creations, 'Tom and Jerry', 'The Flintstones', and 'Scooby Doo'. What was his name?
questions.explanation:
William Hanna.

	Joseph Barbera was the other half of the great animating team.

questions.text: O.C. Smith passed away on November 23, 2001, and was best known for singing this hit song. What was it titled?
questions.explanation:
'Little Green Apples'.

	O.C. was 69 when he passed away.

questions.text: Actress Dorothy McGuire starred in many classic movies. One in particular was about a dog. What was the name of this film?
questions.explanation:
'Old Yeller'.

	Dorothy appeared in 'Three Coins in the Fountain', 'Gentleman's Agreement', and so many others. She passed away on September 13, 2001 at age 83.

questions.text: The world of music mourned the passing of musical great Isaac Stern on September 22, 2001. What was the instrument Mr. Stern was famous for playing?
questions.explanation:
Violin.

	Mr. Stern performed and recorded everything from Brahms and Beethoven to Igor Stravinsky and Leonard Bernstein.

questions.text: The world of music also mourned the passing of another musical great, on November 29, 2001. Who was he?
questions.explanation:
George Harrison.

	The famous 'quiet' member of the Beatles passed away at age 58. Unfortunately, all of these men died this past year. Perry Como on May 12, Joey Ramone on April 15, and John Phillips on March 18.

questions.text: Hank Ketcham passed away on May 31, 2001 at age 81. He was famous for being the creator of what comic strip?
questions.explanation:
'Dennis the Menace'.

	In addition to 'Dennis the Menace', Hank also created great artworks of jazz greats, such as Duke Ellington and Art Tatum.

questions.text: Anthony Quinn starred in many great movies, among them, 'The Guns of Navarone', 'Lawrence of Arabia', and 'Zorba the Greek'. He was born on April 21, 1915. What city was he born in?
questions.explanation:
Chihuahua, Mexico.

	Quinn passed away on June 3, 2001 at age 86.
